variant.question: According to the ILS coverage area as defined by ICAO Annex 10, the pilot will be guaranteed a reliable signal from the localizer at:

options.text: 10 NM from the threshold on an inbound course and 38° displaced from the localizer centreline.
27 NM from the threshold on an inbound course and 8° displaced from the localizer centreline.
19 NM from the threshold on an inbound course and 13° displaced from the localizer centreline.
20 NM from the threshold on an inbound course and 8º displaced from the localizer centreline.

variant.question: A vehicle drives through the critical area of an ILS system while an aircraft is on the approach. What may happen?

options.text: Nothing, the transmission will be blanked and there will be no change to course and glidepath demands.
There will a short term distortion of the signal which will not affect the ILS guidance because the aircraft does not have time to react.
There will be a change in polarization of the signal causing loss of reception.
There may be erroneous course and glidepath demands.
